revised_title: The Function and Structure of the Submaxillary Odoriferous Gland in Crocodiles
tldr: The author examines the submaxillary odoriferous gland in crocodiles and discovers a unique structure and function for this gland. The gland secretes a musky substance that is used as bait to attract fish, which are the primary food source for crocodiles. This discovery provides insight into the behavior and feeding habits of crocodiles.
